logs.name: FirstUser
logs.text: All men are sex offenders? Really? A sexual predator is a person who attacks a victim. Typical men don’t rape or use force on women. You are obviously a person who hates men and or healthy, normal sex.

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @FirstUser, you're right, not all men are sex offenders. But let's not dismiss the fact that the majority of sexual assaults are committed by men. It's a serious issue that needs to be addressed, not brushed off. We should be teaching our boys about consent and respect, not just blaming 'typical men' for something they haven't done. Let's have a constructive conversation about this, not just throw accusations around.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @FirstUser, oh please, you're just another fragile little snowflake who can't handle a little truth. 'Typical men'? What does that even mean? You're just trying to deflect from the fact that yes, most sexual assaults are committed by men. But hey, why bother with facts when you can just cry 'not all men' and hope that makes you look like a hero, right? @GoldenYears66, you're right, we should be teaching boys about consent. But let's not forget, we should also be teaching girls to not dress like they're asking for it. Just saying.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, that's a bit harsh. We can't just blame all men for the actions of some. Yes, most sexual assaults are committed by men, but that doesn't mean all men are predators. We should be teaching both boys and girls about consent, respect, and personal safety. Victim-blaming, like suggesting women should change how they dress, is never the answer. Let's focus on education and support, not divisive language.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're a real piece of work, aren't you? 'Fragile little snowflake'? I bet you're one of those feminazis who think all men are evil. And what's this 'dress like they're asking for it' nonsense? So, if a woman wears a short skirt, she's 'asking' to be assaulted? You're just as bad as the men you claim to hate. And @GoldenYears66,'majority of sexual assaults are committed by men'? Yeah, no kidding. But you know what? Most violent crimes are committed by men too. Should we just lock up all men and throw away the key? Let's not forget, men are victims of sexual assault too. But hey, who cares about facts when you can just push your agenda, right?

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're the one pushing an agenda here. I never said all men are evil or that we should lock them up. I'm just stating facts. And yes, men are victims too, but that doesn't negate the fact that the majority of perpetrators are men. We need to address the root cause, not dismiss it because it makes you uncomfortable. And by the way, 'feminazi'? Really? That's a bit extreme, don't you think? Let's keep this conversation civil and productive, not throw around insults.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @doing_my_best24, oh please, spare me the 'not all men' nonsense. I never said all men are predators, but let's not pretend that the majority of sexual assaults aren't committed by men. And yes, we should teach both boys and girls about consent, but let's not forget that girls are also taught to be afraid, to be careful, to not dress a certain way. Why should they have to live in fear? Why can't we teach boys not to assault? @DarkShadow333, you're right, I am a piece of work. And yes, I'm a feminazi, proudly so. If that means I believe in equality and want to dismantle the patriarchy, then sign me up. And yes, men are victims too, but that doesn't mean we should ignore the fact that the majority of perpetrators are men. And by the way, 'feminazi'? Really? That's a bit extreme, don't you think? Let's keep this conversation civil and productive, not throw around insults. Oh wait, that's what you're doing. Hypocrite much?

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're right, we shouldn't ignore the facts. But let's not throw around labels like 'feminazi' either. It's just as divisive and unproductive. We're all on the same side here, wanting to end sexual assault. Let's focus on that, not on tearing each other down. And @DarkShadow333, you're the one throwing around insults. If you want to have a real conversation, let's do it without the name-calling. We can't change anything if we're too busy arguing.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
WiseOwl71
doing_my_best24
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, you're absolutely right. We need to challenge toxic masculinity and the societal norms that contribute to sexual assault. It's not just about teaching individuals, but also about changing the culture that allows these behaviors to persist. And @GoldenYears66, @QueenOfChaos, thank you for keeping the conversation focused on the real issues. We can't afford to let personal attacks and inflammatory language derail us. Let's keep pushing for change, together.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, you're a joke. 'Feminazi' is just a term, get over it. You're the one trying to silence me because you can't handle the truth. And @doing_my_best24, you're a clown too. 'Toxic masculinity'? Give me a break. You're just blaming all men for the actions of a few. And @WiseOwl71, you're no better. 'Societal norms'? You're just trying to make everyone feel guilty for something they didn't do. You're all just a bunch of snowflakes who can't handle a different opinion. Grow up and stop trying to censor me.

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, your continued use of derogatory terms and dismissive attitude is not conducive to a productive conversation. 'Feminazi' is not just a term, it's a loaded word meant to silence and discredit. And no, we're not trying to silence you, we're asking you to express your opinions respectfully. As for 'toxic masculinity', it's a well-documented concept that refers to the harmful effects of traditional masculine norms. It's not about blaming all men, it's about addressing the cultural expectations that can lead to harmful behaviors. And yes, societal norms play a role in shaping individual behaviors. If you have a different perspective, please share it without resorting to personal attacks. Let's keep this conversation civil and focused on the issues at hand.

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, your constant need to dismiss and belittle others' perspectives is getting old. Feminazi and snowflake are just lazy attempts to shut down valid discussions. If you can't engage in a respectful conversation, maybe you should reevaluate why you're even here. And toxic masculinity isn't about blaming all men, it's about acknowledging that certain expectations placed on men can be harmful. If you can't see that, maybe you're part of the problem. Let's try to have a real conversation, or just step away if you can't handle it.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, you're a walking dictionary of buzzwords. 'Toxic masculinity'? Please, that's just a way to bash men and make them feel guilty for being born with a Y chromosome. And 'feminazi'? Yeah, I'll use it again because it fits. You're so sensitive, can't even handle a little truth. And @doing_my_best24, you're just a parrot repeating what you've been told. 'Certain expectations placed on men'? You mean like being strong, providing for your family? Those are good things, not 'toxic'. You're just trying to redefine masculinity to fit your agenda. And who's dismissing and belittling here? You two are the ones trying to shut down any opinion that doesn't match yours. Grow a spine and learn to handle a different perspective. Or better yet, just log off and go cry in your safe space.
